sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Good afternoon and welcome to Euronews Now. It's Thursday, the 7th of July.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I'm Andrea Balaitho and these are your top stories this hour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Has the end finally come for Boris Johnson?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: British media reports he'll resign as leader of the Tory party today, but he hopes to stay on as Prime Minister until the autumn.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russia's relentless shelling continues in the city of Kharkiv as Moscow intensifies its push to take control of the whole Donbass region. And in a sign of cinematic solidarity, the Kalavivari International Film Festival provides a platform for Ukrainian films as the Odessa Film Festival is cancelled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The drama continues as British Prime Minister Boris Johnson is still clinging on despite a continuous slew of resignations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: More than 40 ministers and junior officials have quit, saying they could no longer serve under his scandal-plagued leadership.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The latest exit is new Chancellor Nadeem Zahawi, who was promoted from Education Secretary to Chancellor only on Tuesday evening.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In his letter to the Prime Minister, Zahawi stated that the situation was not sustainable and will only get worse, urging the Prime Minister to do the right thing and go now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The resignation of Johnson's second chancellor in three days is the latest blow to the weakened government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: There has seen five major resignations so far.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Chancellor Rishi Sunak, Health Secretary Sajid Javid, Welsh secretary Simon Hart, Northern Ireland secretary Brandon Lewis and education secretary Michelle Donilon. During a stormy session of the House of Commons yesterday Johnson stated that he wouldn't leave amid criticism over his handling of sexual misconduct allegations against the senior official.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But frankly Mr. Speaker the job of a Prime Minister in difficult yn ymddangos i'r swyddog gynharach. Mr Speaker Yn gyffredinol, mae swydd Prif Weinidog mewn amhraifft anoddol, pan aeth i'r cyflwyniad, yn parhau i ddilyn, ac mae hynny'n beth bynnag y byddaf i'n ei wneud.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Mr Speaker Roedd yn yr un fath pan oedd arian i'r cyllid yn cael ei ddewis, ac roedd yn yr un fath pan roedd hi a'i ffrwchion wedi parhau eu ffordd trwy'r lockdown. Anyone quitting now after defending all that hasn't got a shred of integrity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Mr Speaker, isn't this the first recorded case of the sinking ships fleeing the rat?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The more the hours pass, the more it seems clear that time may be running out for Johnson.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The country is bracing itself for another day of political chaos.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Well, yesterday was quite possibly the toughest day

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: politically for Boris Johnson since he became prime minister.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He suffered the highest number of government resignations in a 24-hour period in history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He battled through PMQs, battled through a select committee appearance, but late last night he was confronted by senior secretaries of state in No. 10 Downing Street, the likes of Nadeem Zahawi, who was appointed the chancellor only last night, Priti Patel, the Home Secretary, Grant Shapps, the Transport Secretary, and a number of others, who simply told him enough was enough.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He needed to go. He needed to resign for the sake of the party and the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He did have some support from cabinet ministers, like Nadine Dorries, who was the culture secretary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But that meeting was resolved with the prime minister simply refusing to resign.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He says he needs to go on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: If he goes now, there could be a chaotic summer with the prime minister simply refusing to resign. He says he needs to go on. If he goes now, there could be a chaotic summer with the leadership challenge, the war in Ukraine going on, and the cost of living crisis. He says that now that his former chancellor, Rishi Sunak, is gone, he can bring in tax cuts, which he thinks will help with the cost of living. But it remains to be seen whether or not we will see more resignations from that top tier of government, the secretaries of state. The prime minister is really running into trouble here because he now has dozens of jobs of which to replace in his government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And he has not that many on his backbenchers to draw from because of the unhappiness with his leadership.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He could really struggle to fill a government and that could weaken him even further.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: If some of those big names do resign in the next few hours or days, some of those big names do resign in the next few hours or days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He would struggle to find the calibre of candidate needed to fill those jobs and bring confidence that he is trying to set things right.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: So an incredibly difficult time for the prime minister.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He could potentially be in his final few days, but at the moment he seems determined to cling on to power.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Vincent McIverney, Euronews, London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Klingon to power. Vincent McIverney, Euronews, London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Russia's relentless shelling continues to take a heavy toll on life and buildings in eastern Ukraine, in this case in the city of Kharkiv. Wednesday saw casualties on both sides as Moscow intensified its push to take control of the whole Donbass region. The Ukrainian military says it rebuffed some advances, as shelling killed at least eight civilians and wounded a further 25.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Pro-Russian separatists say Ukrainian attacks have killed four civilians on their side.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A spokesman for Russia's Ministry of Defense claimed air-launched high-precision missiles hit two US-made rocket systems and their warehouses in Kharkiv and Donetsk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In Donbass, the artillery battle has been going on for months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian troops are having to rely on armored weapons developed during the Soviet Union era.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Many of those fighting are not Korea soldiers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: At first the fighting was hard, but now we're used to it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: My home is quite close.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In the beginning it was difficult to understand that there was a war going on in my own hometown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The most important thing is that morale remains high and that we don't underestimate ourselves.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Everything will go well.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Ukraine will win." In Kyiv, Irish Prime Minister Michal Martin met President Volodymyr Zelensky.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Ukrainian leader has said that the artillery delivered as part of Western military aid to the beleaguered nation is working very powerfully and delivering noticeable blows in Russian-occupied areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Suwalki Gap along the Polish-Lithuanian border is currently considered one of the most dangerous places in the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Some analysts say that if the Russian war escalates, it will develop there connecting the kaliningrad oblast and Belarus in effect cutting off three Baltic countries from the Western Alice the local population is certainly concerned about this possibility this situation that's developing in Ukraine has prompted people to start thinking about how to defend themselves.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: There's more interest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Nobody's going to dig trenches and wait for something to fall down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We observe. Helicopters fly. Military vehicles pass by. We go on working.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: If we're forced, then we'll probably have to defend ourselves.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I hope this doesn't happen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But the more people who know how to do it, maybe they'll at least feel mentally better, so they're not so alone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Better to be prepared for the worst than not to be prepared.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Local politicians, on the other hand, fear that speculation around the future and the security of the region will only cause harm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The threat we're talking about is only hypothetical, and we want it to stay that way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This situation will have a negative impact on the perception of the region as good for investment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Unfortunately, there'll be fewer tourists this summer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We don't want panic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We are also under the protection of the Polish army and NATO allied troops, which are stationed not so far away from the Sowalki Gap.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And in the event of conflict, I think that our army, with our allies, would be able to repel any attack. Myślę, że nasza armia z sojusznikami jest w stanie odeprzeć ten atak.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Eksperci nie zaznaczają możliwego ataku, choć podkreślają, że nowa operacja wojskowa będzie trudna.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Od wielu lat było to widziane jako najtrudniejsze w związku z wschodnim flankiem.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Nie możemy wyjąć żadnych scenariuszy, ale myślę, że będzie bardzo trudno dla Rosji być w tym samym czasie. to eastern flank. We cannot exclude any scenarios, but I think it will be very difficult for Russia to be at the same time involved in the two fronts, especially when it comes to involvement according to the NATO side. It is low probability.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The eastern borders of Poland, which are also the borders of the European Union, are struggling with the problems coming from the country's eastern neighbors. Aside from war in Ukraine and the migration crisis, there is now a threat of an attack that would start an open war between Russia and NATO. Magdalena Hodovnik for Euronews from Warsaw.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We're going to take a short break now, but still to come on Euronews Now, headlines, top stories and analysis from Europe and the rest of the world.
